_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Commitment-Safety Approach

American Foods Group considers their employees to be their most valuable resource, their health and safety is our greatest responsibility.  As our most valuable resource, we place top priority in informing, educating, protecting, and preserving our employees as valuable members of the company.

American Foods Group's primary focus is to prevent the occurance of unforeseen industrial incidents/accidents from occuring in the work environment.

Facility Descriptions and Regulated Substance

The operations at the facility consists of the processing of beef and speciality meat cuts.  The facility employs approximately 1500 employees (3 shifts).  The refrigeration system at the facility comprises our process with the regulated substance being anhydrous ammonia (NH3).  This is a self contained system which provides the refrigeration for the Green Bay Dressed Beef facility.

Ammonia Refrigeration System Description

The ammonia refrigeration system is a single stage, closed-loop system that is used to provide cooling for process rooms, temerature control, water chilling, temper water for sanitation and freezer storage.

5-year Accident History

There have been no NH3 related incidents identified for the facility in the previous five years which resulted in significant on-site or off-site consequences.

To accomplish the facility's goal in controlling accidental losses, the facility has established a multi faceted safety program.  The objectives of the safety program are to achieve maximum effiency and safety performance.

The facility has implemented a prevention program for the accidental release of the NH3 process elements of the program coincide with the Occupational Safety and Health Administration's Process Safety Management (PSM) standard, 29CFR 1910.119; EPA's Risk Management Program (RMP) Regulation, 40 CFR Part 68; State of Wisconsin's Ref Cocde: Chapter 45, NH3 Refrigeration and LP Gas Inpection Report.  The purpose of the accidental re

lease prevention and emergency response programs is to prevent occurances, and minimize the consequences of significant releases of toxic substances as well as fire, explosion, and other types of catastrophic accidents.

Components of the Accidental Release Prevention Program

The facility's Accidental Release Prevention Program consists of the following elements:

Employee Participation
Process Safety Information
PHA
Operating Procedures
Hot Work Program
Management of Change
Preventative Maintenance
Training
Contractors
Pre-Start Up Safety Review
Mechanical Integrity
Incident Investigation
Compliance Audits
